metadata.name: Yellowstone #01 - Grizzly Encounters
metadata.description:
"Grizzly Encounters"  
Artist: Byron Fichter

Fresh out of hibernation, Grizzlies are on the move! This was my first time spotting this majestic beast in the wild. I was lucky enough to snap off a few quick shots with my telephoto lens, as this male was intently focused on his queen a few yards away. 

Moving with the agility of a house cat, adult grizzlies can tip the scales at nearly 800 pounds. Moves that gain this magnificent mountain of muscle instant street credit. Undoubtedly, the king of Yellowstone National Park. 

**WARNING** Grizzly bears (and all wild animals) can be extremely aggressive, and dangerous. Please do not approach wild animals. Yellowstone National Park suggests keeping a minimum distance of 100 yards (or a football field) distance between yourself, and grizzlies.
